transcript.text: Shalom I'm out here on Mount Soledad
which was a place that John and Shannon
recommended it was completely free to
come up here this cross is the atheists
have tried to take this cross down for
many many years and it survived many
many battles john told me about all the
different lawsuits that the atheist
tried to used it to bring it down but
this is actually a Veterans Memorial but
it gives just an absolutely spectacular
view of San Diego as you can see there's
the ocean there
so I just thought while I'm up here it's
like they might be having a memorial
today but just to honor all these
veterans on this Shabbat I thought I
would read out the psalm for the Sabbath
day just Psalm 92 it is a good thing to
give thanks unto Yahweh and to sing
praises unto thy name almost high to
show forth your loving-kindness in the
morning and your faithfulness every
night upon an instrument of ten strings
and upon the psaltery upon the harp with
a solemn sound actually that should say
upon the harp with a joyful sound for
thou yahweh has made me glad through thy
work and i will try in from the work so
by hands o yahweh how great are thy
works and thy thoughts are very deep a
brutish man knows not neither does a
fool understand this when the wicked
spring is the grass and when all the
workers of iniquity do flourish is that
they shall be destroyed forever
but thou yahweh art most high for
evermore for lo thine enemies o Yahweh
for lo thine enemies Shall Perish and
all the workers of iniquity shall be
scattered but my horn shalt thou exalt
like the horn of a unicorn I shall be
anointed with fresh oil my and I also
shall see my desire on mine enemies and
mine ears shall hear my desire of the
wicked that rise up against me the
righteous shall flourish like the palm
tree he shall grow like a cedar in
Lebanon and those that be planted in the
house of Yahweh shall flourish in the
courts of our Elohim
they shall still bring forth fruit in
old age they shall be fattened
flourishing to show that Yahweh's
upright he is my rock and there is no
unrighteousness in him hello yeah
shabbat shalom everybody let's just kind
of look at the
they have a lot of different photos of
different veterans at this memorial get
an example of this here
Robert Lee Clark my grandfather's name
is robert e lee my grandfather actually
was a veteran he he operated the radios
in World War two he passed away though
back in 1996 what a beautiful memorial
this is gorgeous
hallelujah shabbat shalom everybody
shabbat shalom
